content.description: Around the corner to the left of the overhanging crack problem, find a slopey bulge at about head height. Mantel the bulge and top out.

Move up from the under cling. First move is great, but probably the crux.

When I put this up back in July of 2013, I didn't find anything on this problem and did quite a bit of cleaning, so it probably hadn't been climbed in a while.
content.location: On the back of the boulder closer to the pink crack but still in the Flower Pot area.

content.description:
Sit start off of the right facing thin flake.  Make your way to the lip using crimpers and slopers - the flower pot jug awaits you at the top.

Although rated V4 in the guidebooks and topos, the problem feels much easier than that.

Note:  Officially named "unnamed" in the guidebooks, "Flower Pot Right" is the unofficial name that some climbers have attached to this problem.   If anyone knows the FA and the properly given name, I'm more than happy to change it.
content.location:
On the way to the Pink Crack from Campsite 21. You can see

Pink Crack

from this problem.

content.description:
SDS (the same as for

Flower Pot Right

) but stay low and move left to an obvious scoop and then up to a juggy finish. Short but quality with some enjoyable moves on good stone.

This problem is rated the same as the right variation in the Dr. Topo guide (V4) but it seems very easy for the grade.
Start with a couple of balancy moves, then up onto better holds.   Positive finishing holds are welcome, as a fall from the top would be unpleasant.
Sit start with legs astride the edge. Pull up and work your hands up to positive holds on the arete. Finish by mantling onto the top of the block.
content.location: Located on the right of the boulders

content.description:
Climbs the obvious crack system on the right side of the west face.

The holds improve as you gain height, but take care because the landing is not pretty.
content.location: Located on the west face of the flower pot

content.description:
Sit down start to

The Crack

.

Poor feet and good finger locks soon give way to the easier climbing on

The Crack

.
content.location: Right side of the west face

content.description:
Start between the tree and the rock and work your way up along solid crimps and good feet. Top out on very textured slopers.

The new guidebook calls this "Corridor Overhang."
content.protection: Pad on the bottem of the climb AND top of the boulder next/under the top-out. Spotters
content.location: On the same boulder as "The Crack" on the west face next to the tree and the boulders.

climbs.name: A Garden Full of Flower Pots

content.description: Many variations / eliminants problems exist among the different huecos, pockets and various "flower pot" jugs on this problem.
content.location:
This problem is found on the way to

Pink Crack

.  Found just to the left of Flower Pot Left - look for a large hueco scoop at torso level that more or less marks the start.  Downclimb is to the right of Flower Pot Left / Right's start.
